item.title: Emacs Shortcuts
item.description:
Emacs Shortcuts

  1. Spc f d –> search for files in dired
  2. Spc : –> main command
  3. Spc g s –> git status
  4. Spc n n –> Capture template
  5. Spc n a –> agenda view
  6. Vim commands
    1. Ctrl up , down –> go up and down in file
    2. q [a-z] –> record a macro
    3. Shift » –> indent in code
  7. Evil snipe:
    1. s ch : go to ch ; same as f but more letters
    2. gc : to comment using evil
    3. gs [annotation] –> to go to lines directly like vimium ease
    4. dii –> delete inside indentation
    5. dik –> delete inside plus a line above
  8. Dired buffer shortcuts:
    1. Dired marking and unmarking options: % and * keys
    2. Narrow subtree : (
    3. Show git status for files : )
    4. Diff one file to another: =
    5. Create a directory : +
    6. Up a directory : -
    7. Rename a file: R
    8. Change timestamp of file: T
    9. Copy filename: Y
    10. Open a sub-directory in same menu: I
    11. Change ownership of file: O
    12. Unmark all files: U
    13. Hardlink of file: H
    14. Goto file: J
    15. Counsel search online: K
    16. Encrypt, decrypt a file: ;
    17. Uncompress or compress : Z
    18. Copy file to : C
    19. Byte compile a file: B
    20. Change file mode: M
    21. Copy async to rsync : C-c C-r
    22. Wide dired mode: i
  9. Org table by copying html table: C-c |
  10. Show all project TODOs: Spc p t
  11. Scroll other window : S-up
  12. Scroll other window down : S-down

item.title: Emacs Tramp
item.description:
Tramp mode for sshing

  • Emacs Tramp tricks
  • C-x C-f /ssh:root@ssb.willschenk.com:/etc/host This command will ssh into it and now projects can be browsed into emacs as if it were right here on my local machine. C-x C-f also need not be done since I have bound it to Spc-Spc. C-x C-f /sudo::/etc/hosts : edit file as sudo
  • Also has some tips for docker

item.description:
Emacs

item.title: Emacs Windows Installation
item.description:
Problems with installing

  1. Not having msys2 so that pdftools can’t build [install msys]

  2. Not having mingw so that sqlite can’t build for org-roam [choco install mingw] Don’t even have to do that. The mingw is installed by msys2. So go to mysys2: there will be folder named mingw64. Add it’s bin to the PATH.

       pacman -Syu
   pacman -S base-devel
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-toolchain
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-zlib
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-libpng
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-poppler
   pacman -S mingw-w64-x86_64-imagemagick

  3. Then find a version that supports modules : emax64. This is a well off version and has binaries in different places and things like that because it tries providing it’s own configuration.

item.title: Emacs Setup
item.description:
Python installs

sudo pip install pipenv
sudo pip install pytest
sudo pip install nose
sudo pip install black
sudo pip install pyflakes
sudo pip install poetry
sudo pip install isort
sudo pip install 'python-language-server[all]'

Go setup

sudo pacman --needed --noconfirm -S go
go get -u github.com/motemen/gore
go get -u github.com/nsf/gocode
go get -u golang.org/x/tools/cmd/godoc
go get -u golang.org/x/tools/cmd/goimports
go get -u golang.org/x/tools/cmd/gorename
go get -u golang.org/x/tools/cmd/guru

Markdown setup


sudo pip install grip

Search Ripgrep

sudo pacman --needed --noconfirm -S ripgrep
sudo pacman -S fd

Language tool and aspell

sudo pacman -S languagetool
sudo pacman -S aspell aspell-en

Web

npm install -g js-beautify

Shell

sudo pacman -S shellcheck
npm i -g bash-language-server

Rust

rustup update
rustup component add rls rust-analysis rust-src
rustup component add rustfmt-preview
cargo install cargo-check
rustup component add clippy-preview

Org mode

sudo pacman -S flameshot
sudo pacman -S gnuplot
sudo pacman -S texlive-core texlive-bin texlive-science
sudo pacman -S pandoc
sudo pacman -S hugo

C/C++

sudo pacman -S clang cmake

Delta [ git-delta ]

cargo install git-delta

Add this to your ~/.gitconfig file [core] pager = delta –plus-color="#012800" –minus-color="#340001" –theme=‘Monokai Extended’
